intro: Gomphrena rigida, commonly known as the rigid gomphrena, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its compact, upright growth habit and its striking, spiky flower heads that range in color from pink to red. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are often surrounded by bracts, giving it a unique visual appearance. It is typically grown as an ornamental plant in gardens due to its long-lasting blooms and drought tolerance. Gomphrena rigida thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
